Posts.Content: Nov 14, 2007 11:34AM joleneboyd wrote: Hi everyone, I guess I am a late-comer to this particular thread, but thought I would post anyway since my guess is I won't be the last person going through this.  All of the above comments have been extremely helpful for me.  I just had my consultation with my oncologist about my Oncotype score yesterday.  I scored 11.  My oncologist is a principal investigator for the TAILORx study in our area and gave me the option of participating in the trial.  I was totally shocked at my emotional reaction yesterday (it was off the scale by the end of the night).  I thought I had decided how I wanted to proceed 3 times...and the decision was different every time.  All in less than 24 hours! It was so reassuring to read the above comments and know definitively that not only am I not alone, but that there are many folks out there who have been given a similar choice and chose to go without the chemo.  That has been the biggest struggle for me...trying to determine if my fear of the unknown (what if I don't take chemo and it comes back?) outweighs the benefits of not having chemo. Clearly it is a personal decision for everyone.  I really think my decision now is to participate in the research or not--and give up the final choice in the matter of whether to do chemo or not. Anyway...mostly I just wanted to say thanks to those who have gone through this and shared their experience.  It has been very helpful. Jolene
